Description: The SEC announced settled enforcement actions against seven broker-dealers for failing to disclose they had received payments for providing research coverage of certain public companies, in violation of Section 17(b) of the Securities Act of 1933.

Private Litigation Case Title: Stanfield et al. v First NLC Financial Services LLC, and Sparrow-Milrot et al. v. First NLC Financial Services LLC

Description: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority fined 19 broker-dealers a total of $2.8 million for substantially overstating their advertised trade volume to three private service providers.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government.

Description: Friedman, Billings, Ramsey & Co., Inc. agreed to pay $4 million to NASD to resolve charges relating to improper trading in shares of Compudyne Corporation. It also paid another $3.8 million to the SEC; see https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-friedman-billings-ramsey-and-co-inc
Info Source: FBR to Pay Regulators $7.7 Million to Resolve Charges Related to Improper Short Selling of Compudyne PIPE Shares, PR Newswire, December 20, 2006 (via Nexis).
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government. This case was handled by its predecessor, the National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD).
